title: Prouerbia HN. The prouerbes of HN. which hee; in the dayes of his olde-age; hath set-fourth as similitudes and mysticall sayinges. Translated out of Base-almayne.
author: Niclaes, Hendrik, 1502?-1580?
notes: The first semicolon in the title is backwards, i.e. an inverted question mark?.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
